page.title: 16Mischievous Night
page.content: Mischievous Night is the 4th of November, the night before Bonfire Night. On Mischievous Night groups of local children go out and play tricks on friends and neighbours. There is no definite reason why it is celebrated it is just a local custom. Children go out in the evening and put milk bottles in front of peoples houses so the owners trip over them. Also the empty dustbins into gardens and throw dead leaves through letter boxes. Some of the tricks are more silly like rubbing soap or treacle onto peoples windows or car windscreeens. Children always look forward to Mischief night themselves, but in the morning there are a lot of angry neighbours and broken milk bottles.
